Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services - Office of Charitable and Regulatory Programs

incorporation_agency: Virginia State Corporation Commission - Clerk's Office
charitable_registration_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services - Office of Charitable and Regulatory Programs
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross contributions under $25,000 annually that receive contributions from fewer than 25 contributors may be exempt from registration. Religious organizations are also exempt.

formation_requirements.notes: Virginia requires a registered agent with a Virginia address. Uniquely, Virginia allows single-director nonprofits. Filing can be done online via CLIS system.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia State Corporation Commission - Clerk's Office
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by last day of anniversary month of incorporation
required_information: Confirmation of registered agent and office
requirements.notes: Virginia requires only a fee payment, not a full report. Late fee of $25 applies. No detailed information update required unless changes need to be filed separately.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
required_information: Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Initial registration fee is $100. Organizations under $25,000 from fewer than 25 contributors may be exempt. Registration required before soliciting.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end, but no later than May 1st
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual fee is $325 ($30 base + $0.50 per $1,000 of contributions, max $325). Due earlier of 6 months after fiscal year end or May 1st. Late fee $50.

requirements.requirement_name: Virginia Retail Sales and Use Tax Exemption Certificate
requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.notes: Virginia provides sales tax exemption for qualifying 501(c)(3) organizations. Not all purchases are exempt - exemption applies to purchases for charitable purposes. Provide Form ST-13 to vendors.

requirements.filing_agency: Local Commissioner of Revenue or County Assessor
requirements.due_date_specifics: File annually by February 1st or within 60 days of property acquisition
requirements.form_number: Varies by locality - Application for Exemption
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
requirements.notes: Property must be owned by nonprofit and used exclusively for charitable, educational, or religious purposes. Annual application required by February 1st. Contact local commissioner of revenue for specific forms.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services - Charitable Gaming Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Permit valid for fiscal year; renew annually
required_information: Proof of 3+ years continuous operation in Virginia
List of officers and gaming managers
requirements.notes: Virginia allows raffles, bingo, and instant bingo for qualified nonprofits in existence for 3+ years. Organization must be based in Virginia. Quarterly reporting required.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: File application at least 30 days before raffle
requirements.notes: Organizations without a charitable gaming permit can conduct up to 2 raffles per year with individual raffle licenses. Prize limit $40,000 per raffle.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional solicitors. Each campaign must be registered. Bond must remain in effect. Written disclosure to donors required.

requirements.filing_agency: Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting but does not solicit or handle contributions. No bond required. Each contract must be filed.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and may be required for Form 103
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (completed before Form 103 due)
requirements.notes: Virginia does not legally mandate audits based solely on revenue, but professional fundraiser use may trigger audit requirements. Many funders and best practices require audits for organizations over $500,000.

special_notes.dual_deadline: Virginia's annual charitable report (Form 103) is due the earlier of 6 months after fiscal year end OR May 1st. Organizations must track both dates.
special_notes.high_annual_fee: Virginia's annual charitable registration fee of up to $325 is among the highest nationally. Fee is calculated based on contributions ($30 + $0.50 per $1,000).
special_notes.single_director_allowed: Virginia allows nonprofit corporations to have just one director, providing flexibility for small organizations. This is unusual among states.
special_notes.three_year_gaming: Virginia requires 3 years of continuous operation before charitable gaming, shorter than some states but still a barrier for new organizations.
special_notes.board_requirements: Virginia nonprofits may have one or more directors. If only one director, that person has full authority. Best practice is to have at least three.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_contracts: All contracts with professional solicitors or fundraising counsel must be filed with VDACS before solicitation begins.
special_notes.charitable_gaming_types: Virginia permits raffles, bingo, instant bingo, pull tabs, and network bingo for qualified nonprofits. Each has specific rules and reporting requirements.
special_notes.property_tax_annual: Property tax exemption must be claimed annually by February 1st. Missing deadline means no exemption for that tax year.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes. VDACS should be notified.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and Virginia Corporate Income Tax Return if conducting business in Virginia.
special_notes.may_first_deadline: The May 1st absolute deadline for Form 103 is unique. Organizations with late fiscal year ends must file before completing their full fiscal year.
special_notes.registration_threshold: Virginia's registration threshold of $25,000 from fewer than 25 contributors is one of the more restrictive - most states use $25,000 alone.
